newsitem.title: UK: Two more human "mad cow" cases in Britain.
newsitem.headline: Two more human "mad cow" cases in Britain.

text.p: Two more people in Britain have succumbed to the new human brain disease linked with mad cow disease, the government reported on Monday.

It said on its monthly report on Creutzfeldt-Jakob disease (CJD) that 19 people had contracted a new variant of the fatal brain illness. It said one definite case --- confirmed by brain biopsy -- was still alive.

In March 1996 British government scientists said they had identified a new strain of the always-fatal brain-wasting disease and said it probably came from eating beef infected with bovine spongiform encephalopathy (BSE or mad cow disease).
Doctors say it is far too soon to know if an epidemic of the new strain of CJD will mirror the BSE epidemic that decimated British herds in the 1980s.
CJD usually strikes one person in a million and so far numbers have not exceeded the expected occurrence.
